attributes.title: Physical stock verification.
attributes.description:
Physical stock was verified on 18.03.2025.

The table below shows the summary of the stock findings

·           The following were the stock findings;

ü  Bread -     -35.25 loaves.

ü  Cumulative variance in polybags was -271 pieces.

All other materials had negligible variances.
attributes.recommendation: + The management to ensure that the set stock controls are consistently adhered to avoid stock variances.
attributes.effect: + Minimal item variation suggest strong internal controls.

value: + Stock was okay and strong internal controls will be maintained.
+ Stock is verified regularly (weekly) to ensure strong internal controls.
+ Physical stock verified on 16.02.25 showed minimal item variations.
Previous

+   A stock take exercise was conducted on 18.03.25 to assess the effectiveness of internal controls that are put in place to safeguard company assets such as the production materials and the finished products.
+ Minimal variances noted in stock items is an indication that stock controls are being observed.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring strong internal controls.

attributes.title: Dough weight analysis
attributes.description:
Dough weights were analyzed on 19.03.25.

+ Compliance to set standard dough dividing weight range was noted.

Dough weights sampled on 19.03.2025:(1  shift @8.30am)
attributes.recommendation: + Adherence to set standard dough dividing weights is commendable.
attributes.effect: Standard dough weights ensures standard bread weight production.

value: + We will always do what it takes to ensure compliance of dough weights.
+ standard dough weights will be adhered to always.
+ Dough weights not sampled.
Previous
+ Dough weights were sampled to check compliance. Dough weight extremes would mean over and underweight bread production.
+ Adherence to set dough weights implies that standard bread weight is produced.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring compliance to set standard dough weights.

attributes.title: Packed bread weight analysis.
attributes.description:
+ Packed bread was weighed on 18.03.25.

+ High overweight bread rate was noted for 600g, 800g and 1.5kg white bread.
attributes.recommendation:
+ Standard set dough dividing weights should be adhered to in order to ensure production of standard weight bread.

Noted high overweight bread rate should be addressed.
attributes.effect:
+ The company risks penalties from weight regulatory bodies due to underweight bread.

+ Revenues loss is imminent due to overweight bread production.

value: + Noted high overweight bread will be addressed.
+ We will put stringent measures to address bread weight extremes.
+ High overweight and underweight bread was noted for packed bread weighed on 16.02.2025.
Previous
+ Sample varieties of packed bread were randomly picked and weighed to establish whether the branch adheres to weights and measures standards.

+    Under and overweight bread presence suggests inconsistency during dough dividing.

+   Presence of underweight bread exposes the company to risks of fines and penalties from regulatory bodies.

 +  High overweight bread on the other end deprives the company revenues because this lowers expected yields.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring production of standard weight bread.

attributes.title: Bread damage analysis.
attributes.description:
+ Bread damage analysis was done for the month of February 2025.

+ High production bread damages was noted.
attributes.recommendation:
+ Proper baking processes will ensure that damages are fully checked.

+ The management should focus on efforts to address high production damages to ensure that the company doesn’t lose revenues.
attributes.effect: + High production damages increased production costs.

value: + We will put more efforts to address noted high production damages.

+     Branch recorded actual prod damages and the average per day was 18.49 loaves, will check and reduce to the set standard.

+      Noted high production damages will be addressed.
+ February 2025 audit report highlighted high production bread damages as analyzed from 01.01.25 – 15.02.25.
Previous

+ The test was conducted to determine the extent of damages produced during production and those replaced as market damages and find out if they were within expected/set limits. High damages suggest bread of inferior quality produced.
+ High production damages implies that the company is exposed to losses and revenue targets were not realized.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring controlled bread damages.

attributes.title: Mixing charts analysis.
attributes.description:
Below are the summary of the findings

01/02/2025 – 28/02/2025

                                         01/03/25 – 17.03.2025

·          The above tables shows that;

·          There was no significant variance between system and the actual material consumption.

+ Correct posting was also noted over the audited period.
attributes.recommendation: + The branch should continue observing the set consumption and production standards.
attributes.effect: + There was accountability for raw materials and finished goods

value: ·           This is noted and will be maintained.
+ We will always ensure that actual production is reflected on production records/registers.
+ February 2025 audit report highlighted that mixing charts/summaries records matched those posted on SAP system as analyzed from 01.01.25 - 16.02.25.
Previous
+ Comparison of manual mixing charts and the system mixing charts was done from 01.02.25 – 17.03.25 to find out if accurate transfer of production data was being done.
+ Consumption and production set standards were observed and this implies proper accountability of raw materials and finished goods.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring that actual mixing chart records are accurately transferred to mixing chart summaries and posted accurately on SAP system.

attributes.title: Raw material consumption analysis.
attributes.description: + Yeast and utto consumption was as per set consumption standards.
attributes.recommendation: + Observed adherence to set standard raw material consumption quantities is commendable.
attributes.effect: + Adherence to set recipes ensures quality bread production and this also checks production costs.

value: + Raw materials consumption was as per expected.
+ Raw materials were issued and consumed as per set standards and this will be maintained.
+ February 2025 audit report highlighted that raw material consumption was as per set standards as analyzed from 01.01.25 - 31.01.25.
Previous
+ This exercise was conducted to determine if set consumption standards for raw materials were adhered to as per company policy.
+ Adherence to set raw materials consumption standards ensures accountability for the same and checks production costs.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring that raw material consumption is as per set standards.

attributes.title: Physcal cash verification
attributes.description:
·           Physical cash was verified on 18/03/2025, and below is a tabular analysis of the same.

·           Minimal variances were noted during spot-check.
attributes.recommendation: ·          Observed cash control is commendable.

value: + Proper cash control will be maintained.
+ This trend will be maintained. Regular spot checks are done to ensure cash control is maintained.
+ Cash control was noted for physical cash verification on 17/02/25.
Previous
+ A spot check was done on cash office to verify if the company petty cash was well maintained.
+ Minimal cash variance suggests minimal cash loss risk and effective controls were put in place.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring proper cash management.

attributes.title: Mini shop spot check.
attributes.description:
·          Mini shop spot check was conducted on 18.03.2025.

·         The shop attendant accounted for all the bread loaded.

·         All sales were made through Mpesa till.

·         The below table shows details of mini shop transactions.
attributes.recommendation: + The Mini shop attendant should keep up with the observed good stock and cash control.
attributes.effect:
+ Bread loss risk was minimal.

+ There was accountability of transferred bread to the mini shop.

value: + Mini shop spot checks will always be enhanced to ensure accountability.
+ Controls on mini shop to be maintained.
·          Spot checks at the mini shop on 16.02.25 showed that all bread loaded was fully accounted for.
Previous
·          A spot check was conducted in the mini shop to assess whether their operations were being carried out in accordance with the established standards.
+ Minishop SOPs are followed.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring accountability of bread sales at the mini shop.

attributes.title: Bread yields analysis
attributes.recommendation: + Set yield targets should be adhered to maximize revenues as observed.
attributes.effect: + Revenue targets were realized by achieving set yield targets.

value: + we are always keen to ensure set bread yields are recorded.
+ We will continue to ensure adherence to set bread yields.
+ February 2025 audit report highlighted that set standard yields were adhered to as analyzed from 01.01.25 - 31.01.25.
Previous
+ Analysis was carried out to determine prevailing yields and establish if they are at par with those expected.
+ Set standard yields were realized and therefore revenue targets were realized as well.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensured realization of set standard bread yields.

attributes.title: Production efficiency analysis.
attributes.description:
·          Analysis was done from 01/02/2025 - 17/03/2025. Production efficiency is tabulated below;

·          Analysis shows that set production efficiency was realized.
attributes.recommendation: + Noted adherence to set production efficiency standards is commendable and encouraged.

value: + We will continue adhering to set operational efficiencies and even improve on the same.
+ Adherence to set operational efficiencies will be maintained.
+ February 2025 audit report highlighted realization of set standard production efficiency as analyzed from 01.01.25 - 31.01.25.
Previous
+     This test was conducted to determine if set production  efficiency was adhered to. Low efficiency would indicate increased production costs.
+ Adherence to set production efficiency checked production costs.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensure realization of set production efficiency.

attributes.title: Packing efficiency analysis
attributes.description:
·          Packing efficiency (01/02/2025 – 17/03/25) is tabulated below;

Set packing efficiency was almost realized.
attributes.recommendation: + Set packing efficiency was almost realized and branch management should put more efforts to ensure set packing targets are achieved in order to check production costs.

value: + We will put more efforts to ensure packing efficiency set is achieved.
+ Packing efficiency set standards were almost realized and stringent measures will be put in place to ensure compliance.
+ February 2025 audit findings showed that packing efficiency set standards were realized as analyzed from 01.01.25 - 31.01.25.
Previous
·          This test was conducted to determine if set  packing efficiency was adhered to. Low efficiency would indicate increased production costs.
+ Packing inefficiency will increase production costs.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring that set packing efficiency standards are realized to check production costs.

attributes.title: Generator fuel consumption.
attributes.description:
GENERATOR : (17/02/25 - 19/03/25)

·           Below is a tabular illustration of generator consumption.

Set standard fuel consumption for the generator was not provided.
attributes.recommendation: + KAF should set generator fuel consumption rate.
attributes.effect: + Fuel consumption by generator can not be properly monitored since the machine has no set standard fuel consumption rate.

value: + We will engage the concerned department in order to have set generator fuel consumption standards.
+ We will engage KAF to have the generator consumption rate determined.
+ February 2025 audit report highlighted that generator had no set standard fuel consumption rate.
Previous

+ The exercise was carried out to determine if fuel consumption quantities by s generator was at par with those provided on the revised permanent file. High fuel consumption would read increased operation costs.
+ Failure to have set generator fuel consumption rate means its impossible to monitor fuel consumption for the generator.
Transport/Fleet Department
+ Ensuring there is set generator fuel consumption standard rate in order to have proper fuel management.

attributes.title: Motor vehicles fuel consumption standard rate
attributes.description: ·           Motor vehicle fuel consumption standards is as follows;
attributes.recommendation: + Having set fuel consumption standards for sales vans enables proper fuel management. This makes it easy to predetermine fuel to be purchased for the next trip/journey.
attributes.effect: + Set fuel consumption rate makes it possible to monitor motor vehicle fuel consumption.

value: + Motor vehicles fuel consumption standard is provided for each van.
+ We always ensure that fuel consumption standard for each van is provided before using the vehicle for sales.
+ February 2025 audit report showed that all motor vehicles had set fuel consumption standards.
Previous
+ Fuel consumption standards was set for all motor vehicles.
Transport/Fleet Department
+ Ensuring that all motor vehicles at the branch have set fuel consumption standards.

attributes.title: Motor vehicle fuel consumption analysis.
attributes.description:
+ Analysis for motor vehicle fuel consumption was carried out from 01/02/2025 – 28/02/2025 and results were analyzed on the below table.

+ Economical fuel consumption was noted for all sales vans.
attributes.recommendation: + Economical fuel consumption noted is commendable.
attributes.effect: + High costs of operation was checked.

value: + Daily monitoring of vans is always ensured to observe fuel consumption set policies.
+  We will maintain the observed trend.
+ February 2025 audit report highlighted economical fuel consumption for sales vans as analyzed for the month of January 2025.
Previous

+ The exercise was carried out to determine if fuel consumption quantities by sales vans  was at par with those provided on the revised permanent file. High fuel consumption would read increased operation costs.
+ Economical fuel consumption was noted for all motor vehicles.
Transport/Fleet Department
+ Ensuring compliance to set standard fuel consumption for motor vehicles.

attributes.title: Customer outstanding debt analysis.
attributes.description:
+ Analysis of the branch outstanding balances was done as at 19 March 2025 for routes and institutions.

+ Customer outstanding balances were noted.

·         Outstanding debts for customers was Kshs.398, 314.00 while for institutions was Kshs.832, 349.00.
attributes.recommendation: + Sales team must ensure credit limits for institutions are set and follow up.
attributes.effect: +  Outstanding debts are a liability to the company.

value:
+ Credit limit is set for institutions.

+ We don’t supply customers with outstanding debts in that the SAP system is locked such that it doesn’t allow invoicing for such customers.
·         Will follow up with the sales rep and the TSM, at the moment all customers with balances aren’t supplied until the debt is cleared.
+ February 2025 audit report highlighted customer outstanding balances as at 16.02.2025.
Current
+ Analysis of the branch outstanding balances as at 19th March 2025 for routes and institutions was done to determine the debtors’ value and if the company is exposed to bad debts.
+ High route balances without equal security deposit poses a great risk to the company of bad debts.
Finance Department
+ Ensuring that there are no customer outstanding balances.
